skeleton.translation[0].definitions[0].d: the structure consisting of all the bones in a human or animal body
skeleton.translation[0].definitions[1].d: a set of these bones or a model of them, fastened in their usual positions, used, for example, by medical students
skeleton.translation[0].definitions[2].d: the most important parts of something, to which more detail can be added later
skeleton.translation[0].definitions[2].e: We agreed on a skeleton outline of the proposal.
skeleton.translation[0].definitions[3].d: an extremely thin person or animal
skeleton.translation[0].definitions[3].e: The disease had reduced Harry to a skeleton.
skeleton.translation[0].definitions[4].d: the main structure that supports a building, bridge etc
skeleton.translation[0].definitions[4].e: Minutes after the explosion, all that remained was the skeleton of the bridge.
skeleton.translation[0].definitions[5].d: a sport in which you slide down a special ice track while lying on your front on a type of sledge
skeleton.translation[0].definitions[6].d: the vehicle you slide on in this sport
